pullRequest.title: [MOB-2411] - Offline flag in config
pullRequest.bodyText:
🔹 Jira Ticket(s) if any
https://iterable.atlassian.net/browse/MOB-2411
✏️ Description

Added offlineProcessing boolean flag in config defaulted to false.
Added setRequestProcessor method in apiClient for IterableApi to be able to set offline mode after/during initializaiton.
In IterableAPI, if the flag is true, setRequestProcessor to offline.

Consequence: Had to make apiClient static and its required authProvider static as well.

nodes.bodyText: I think this is confusing.. setRequestProcessor(true, context) - for a setter, I'd expect it to take some kind of a RequestProcessor class.. What true means in this case isn't clear. And do we need to pass a Context here?
This should be package-private for now, since it's not ready for production use yet.
Do we need to make this static?

beforeCommit.message:
[MOB-2411] - Offline flag in config

1.  Added offlineProcessing boolean flag in config defaulted to false.
2. Added setRequestProcessor method in apiClient for IterableApi to be able to set offline mode after/during initializaiton.
3. In IterableAPI, if the flag is true, setRequestProcessor to offline.

Consequence: Had to make apiClient static and its required authProvider static as well.

afterCommit.message:
[MOB-2411] - Offline flag in config

Revised PR:
1.  Added offlineProcessing boolean flag in `IterableConfig` defaulted to false with package private method `setOfflineProcessing`
2.  Added enableOfflineProcessing method in apiClient for IterableApi to be able to set offline mode after/during initializaiton.
3.  In IterableAPI, if the flag is true, the method is called.

update: Reverted to `non-static` for apiclient and authHandler

nodes.bodyText: We don't need to reset apiClient on logout
The condition check is both here and inside enableOfflineProcessing. I think either the method should not have parameters, or we don't need the check here.

afterCommit.message:
[MOB-2411] - Offline flag in config

Revised PR:
1.  Added offlineProcessing boolean flag in `IterableConfig` defaulted to false with package private method `setOfflineProcessing`
2.  Added setOfflineProcessingEnabled method in apiClient for IterableApi to be able to set offline/online mode after/during initializaiton.
3.  Based on flag true or false, online or offline requestProcessor is initialized. Any requestprocessor invocation before that will pass through onlineRequestProcessor

update: Reverted to `non-static` for apiclient and authHandler

nodes.bodyText: The test now checks for two things at the same time: that setOfflineProcessingEnabled was called and that no API requests are being made. I think ideally it shouldn't be explicitly checking for setOfflineProcessingEnabled.

commit.message:
[MOB-2411] - Offline flag in config

Revised PR:
1.  Added offlineProcessing boolean flag in `IterableConfig` defaulted to false with package private method `setOfflineProcessing`
2.  Added setOfflineProcessingEnabled method in apiClient for IterableApi to be able to set offline/online mode after/during initializaiton.
3.  Based on flag true or false, online or offline requestProcessor is initialized. Any requestprocessor invocation before that will pass through onlineRequestProcessor

update: Reverted to `non-static` for apiclient and authHandler
